text: Kim Gellard is a Canadian curler. She is a and . At a Toronto high school curling competition, Gellard skipped a team that scored back-to-back eight- enders. An eight ender is scoring eight points (with all eight rocks) in an end is extremely rare in its own right.Bob Weeks, Curling For Dummies, pg 148 ==Awards== * All-Star Team: ()SCOTT TOURNAMENT OF HEARTS AWARDS AND ALL-STAR TEAMS | Soudog's Curling History Site ==Personal life== Gellard is a graduate of Markham District High School.https://yrdsb.civicweb.net/document/1249 ==Teams and events== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Coach ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 1990–91 | Deborah Green || Kim Gellard || Lisa Rowsell || Corrine Beveridge || || || CJCC 1991 (6th) |- ! scope="row"| 1991–92 | Heather Crockett || Kim Gellard || Johnalee Fraser || Corie Beveridge || || || CJCC 1992 |- ! scope="row"| 1992–93 | Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Lisa Savage || Sandy Graham || || || CJCC 1993 |- ! scope="row"| 1993–94 | Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Lisa Savage || Sandy Graham || Heather Crockett || || |- ! scope="row"| 1995–96 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Jane Hooper Perroud || Lisa Savage || || |- ! scope="row"| 1996–97 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Jane Hooper Perroud || Lisa Savage || Mary Gellard || (8th) |- ! scope="row"| 1997–98 | Marilyn Bodogh || Kim Gellard || Corie Beveridge || Jane Hooper Perroud || || || COCT 1997 (6th) |- ! scope="row"| 1998–99 | Kim Gellard || Sherry Scheirich || Sally Karam || Allison Ross || Mary Gellard || || (9th) |} ==References== ==External links== * *Kim Gellard - Curling Canada Stats Archive *Corie Beveridge ; Lisa Rowsell; Kim Gellard and Debbie Green win big.
